docs.snippet: Rafael Nadal kept rolling in his first clay-court of the season with a 7-5, 6-3 victory on Thursday over fellow Spaniard and friend Pablo Carreno Busta to reach the quarterfinals of the Rio Open.
docs.lead_paragraph: Rafael Nadal kept rolling in his first clay-court of the season with a 7-5, 6-3 victory on Thursday over fellow Spaniard and friend Pablo Carreno Busta to reach the quarterfinals of the Rio Open.

headline.main: Nadal Not Great, but Makes Quarterfinals on Clay in Rio
headline.print_headline: Nadal Not Great, but Makes Quarterfinals on Clay in Rio

docs.snippet: Errani reached the semifinals of the Rio Open after Beatriz Haddad Maia of Brazil retired in the deciding third set.
docs.lead_paragraph: Errani reached the semifinals of the Rio Open after Beatriz Haddad Maia of Brazil retired in the deciding third set.

headline.main: Sara Errani Reaches Semifinals on Clay in Rio de Janeiro
headline.print_headline: Yawn: Nadal Gets Victory in Rio at 3:21 in the Morning

docs.snippet: In what is becoming an increasingly nasty grudge match, the White House is mulling ways to undercut Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's upcoming trip to Washington and blunt his message that a potential nuclear deal with Iran is bad for...
docs.lead_paragraph: In what is becoming an increasingly nasty grudge match, the White House is mulling ways to undercut Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's upcoming trip to Washington and blunt his message that a potential nuclear deal with Iran is bad for Israel and the world.

headline.main: Unwelcome Mat: White House Tries to Counter Netanyahu Visit
headline.print_headline: Unwelcome Mat: White House Tries to Counter Netanyahu Visit

docs.snippet: The mayor of Venezuela's capital Caracas will fight charges of plotting violence against the socialist government, his lawyer said on Saturday, denouncing the accusations as baseless.
docs.lead_paragraph: The mayor of Venezuela's capital Caracas will fight charges of plotting violence against the socialist government, his lawyer said on Saturday, denouncing the accusations as baseless.

headline.main: Caracas Mayor to Appeal 'Unfounded' Charges, Lawyer Says
headline.print_headline: Caracas Mayor to Appeal 'Unfounded' Charges, Lawyer Says

docs.snippet: A world-conquering start-up finds itself lost in translation in Tokyo.
docs.lead_paragraph: A world-conquering start-up finds itself lost in translation in Tokyo.
docs.abstract: Airbnb is struggling to replicate its worldwide success in Japan, which has society that is resistant to foreigners and risk-taking; company has dispatched researchers to see why the few Japanese hosts who have signed up with site are so amenable to the service, and whether they can use that information to make it more appealing to more Japanese people.

headline.main: Meet the Unlikely Airbnb Hosts of Japan
headline.print_headline: 'How Can We Find More People Like You?'

docs.snippet: Thirty-five-year-old Abdalmalik Wahab had been imprisoned at Guantanamo Bay for nearly 14 years without charge when he got some good news: The U.S. government was no longer interested in holding him.
docs.lead_paragraph: Thirty-five-year-old Abdalmalik Wahab had been imprisoned at Guantanamo Bay for nearly 14 years without charge when he got some good news: The U.S. government was no longer interested in holding him.

headline.main: Lost Amid Fiery Rhetoric: Progress Toward Closing Guantanamo
headline.print_headline: Lost Amid Fiery Rhetoric: Progress Toward Closing Guantanamo

docs.snippet: FIFA has recommended that Qatar hosts a shorter World Cup in 2022 staged over the cooler months of November and December in a move sure to set world soccer's governing body on a collision course with the major European leagues.
docs.lead_paragraph: FIFA has recommended that Qatar hosts a shorter World Cup in 2022 staged over the cooler months of November and December in a move sure to set world soccer's governing body on a collision course with the major European leagues.

headline.main: FIFA Recommends Shorter November-December World Cup for Qatar 2022
headline.print_headline: FIFA Recommends Shorter November-December World Cup for Qatar 2022

docs.snippet: South American soccer bosses have yet to react to a possible November-December 2022 World Cup but such a date change should cause little commotion in a region that traditionally ends its season a few weeks before Christmas.
docs.lead_paragraph: South American soccer bosses have yet to react to a possible November-December 2022 World Cup but such a date change should cause little commotion in a region that traditionally ends its season a few weeks before Christmas.

headline.main: Latin America Unruffled by World Cup Date Change
headline.print_headline: Latin America Unruffled by World Cup Date Change

docs.snippet: Manchester City suffered from deja vu as Luis Suarez's double gave Barcelona a 2-1 first leg lead in a Champions League last 16 tie at the Etihad although Lionel Messi's late penalty miss left the door ajar on Tuesday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Manchester City suffered from deja vu as Luis Suarez's double gave Barcelona a 2-1 first leg lead in a Champions League last 16 tie at the Etihad although Lionel Messi's late penalty miss left the door ajar on Tuesday.

headline.main: Suarez Puts Barca on Top as Messi Misses Penalty
headline.print_headline: Suarez Puts Barca on Top as Messi Misses Penalty

docs.snippet: Manchester City were outplayed by Barcelona for most of their Champions League first leg tie on Tuesday but will still go to the Nou Camp hopeful of reaching the last eight for the first time thanks to Joe Hart.
docs.lead_paragraph: Manchester City were outplayed by Barcelona for most of their Champions League first leg tie on Tuesday but will still go to the Nou Camp hopeful of reaching the last eight for the first time thanks to Joe Hart.

headline.main: Hart Says Penalty Save Will Give City Belief
